document.topic_text: Spokane Public Schools offer free vaccine clinics Rogers, Ferris, Shadle and Shaw Middle School will also host them this week. Erin Robinson , wsts2 6:01 PM. PDT April 24, 2016 Spokane Public Schools CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST SPOKANE, Wash. – Several Spokane Public Schools are hosting free childhood vaccination clinics from April 25-April 29. The clinics are in partnership with other area school districts, as well as the Spokane Regional Health District, the Group Health Foundation and Medical Reserve Corps of Washington. For more information on childhood immunizations and Washington state law, click here. Dates and times of clinics: Monday, April 25 North Central High School, 3:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m., 1600 N. Howard St. Tuesday, April 26 Farwell Elementary, 3:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m., 13005 N. Crestline Rogers High School, 3:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m., 1622 E. Wellesley Ave Wednesday, April 27 McDonald Elementary, 2 p.m.-6 p.m., 1512 S McDonald Rd Ferris High School, 3:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m., 3020 E 37 th Ave Thursday, April 28 Centennial Middle School, 2 p.m.-6 p.m., 915 N. Ella Rd Shadle High School, 3:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m., 4327 N. Ash St Friday, April 29 Shaw Middle School, 3:30 p.m.-6:30 p.m., 4106 N. Cook St KREM
